13  package org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.cache;
14  
15  import java.security.PrivateKey;
16  import java.security.cert.X509Certificate;
17  import java.util.ArrayList;
18  import java.util.List;
19  import org.apache.log4j.Logger;
20  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.CertificateID;
21  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.OCSPException;
22  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.RespID;
23  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.jcajce.JcaRespID;
24  import org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateStatus;
25  import org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.SHA1DigestCalculator;
26  import org.cesecore.config.OcspConfiguration;
27  import org.cesecore.keybind.impl.OcspKeyBinding;
28  import org.cesecore.util.CertTools;
29  
30  /**
31   * Hold information needed for creating an OCSP response without database
32   * lookups.
33   *
34   * @version $Id: OcspSigningCacheEntry.java 28643 2018-04-06 08:53:57Z samuellb
35   *     $
36   */
37  public class OcspSigningCacheEntry {
38  
39      /** Logger. */
40    private static final Logger LOG =
41        Logger.getLogger(OcspSigningCacheEntry.class);
42  
43    /** ID. */
44    private final List<CertificateID> certificateID;
45    /** Chain. */
46    private final List<X509Certificate> caCertificateChain;
47    /** Cert. */
48    private final X509Certificate ocspSigningCertificate;
49    /** Chain. */
50    private final List<X509Certificate> fullCertificateChain;
51    /** Vert. */
52    private final X509Certificate signingCertificate;
53    /** DN. */
54    private final String signingCertificateIssuerDn;
55    /** Issuer. */
56    private final String signingCertificateIssuerDnRaw;
57    /** Key. */
58    private final transient PrivateKey privateKey;
59    /** Provider. */
60    private final String signatureProviderName;
61    /** Binding. */
62    private final OcspKeyBinding ocspKeyBinding;
63    /** CA cert. */
64    private final X509Certificate issuerCaCertificate;
65    /** Status. */
66    private final CertificateStatus issuerCaCertificateStatus;
67    /** Verified. */
68    private boolean responseSignatureVerified = false;
69    /** Type. */
70    private final OcspKeyBinding.ResponderIdType responderIdType;
71    /** ID. */
72    private RespID respId;
73    /** Chain. */
74    private final X509Certificate[] responseCertChain;
75    /** Cert. */
76    private final boolean signingCertificateForOcspSigning;
77  
78    /**
79     * @param aIssuerCaCertificate Cert
80     * @param aIssuerCaCertificateStatus Status
81     * @param signingCaCertificateChain Chain
82     * @param aOcspSigningCertificate Cert
83     * @param aPrivateKey Key
84     * @param aSignatureProviderName Provider
85     * @param aOcspKeyBinding Binding
86     * @param aResponderIdType Type
87     */
88    public OcspSigningCacheEntry(
89        final X509Certificate aIssuerCaCertificate,
90        final CertificateStatus aIssuerCaCertificateStatus,
91        final List<X509Certificate> signingCaCertificateChain,
92        final X509Certificate aOcspSigningCertificate,
93        final PrivateKey aPrivateKey,
94        final String aSignatureProviderName,
95        final OcspKeyBinding aOcspKeyBinding,
96        final OcspKeyBinding.ResponderIdType aResponderIdType) {
97      this.caCertificateChain = signingCaCertificateChain;
98      this.ocspSigningCertificate = aOcspSigningCertificate;
99      if (aOcspSigningCertificate == null) {
100       // We will sign with a CA key
101       fullCertificateChain = signingCaCertificateChain;
102     } else {
103       // We will sign with an OCSP Key Binding
104       fullCertificateChain = new ArrayList<X509Certificate>();
105       fullCertificateChain.add(aOcspSigningCertificate);
106       fullCertificateChain.addAll(signingCaCertificateChain);
107     }
108     if (fullCertificateChain == null) {
109       // This is just a placeholder cache entry
110       signingCertificate = null;
111     } else {
112       // Get the certificate that corresponds to the private key
113       signingCertificate = fullCertificateChain.get(0);
114     }
115     this.privateKey = aPrivateKey;
116     this.signatureProviderName = aSignatureProviderName;
117     this.ocspKeyBinding = aOcspKeyBinding;
118     this.issuerCaCertificate = aIssuerCaCertificate;
119     this.certificateID =
120         OcspSigningCache.getCertificateIDFromCertificate(aIssuerCaCertificate);
121     this.issuerCaCertificateStatus = aIssuerCaCertificateStatus;
122     this.responderIdType = aResponderIdType;
123     if (signingCertificate == null) {
124       // This is just a placeholder cache entry
125       respId = null;
126       signingCertificateForOcspSigning = true;
127       signingCertificateIssuerDn = null;
128       signingCertificateIssuerDnRaw = null;
129     } else {
130       // Pre-calculate the Responder ID
131       if (OcspKeyBinding.ResponderIdType.NAME.equals(aResponderIdType)) {
132         respId = new JcaRespID(signingCertificate.getSubjectX500Principal());
133       } else {
134         try {
135           respId =
136               new JcaRespID(
137                   signingCertificate.getPublicKey(),
138                   SHA1DigestCalculator.buildSha1Instance());
139         } catch (OCSPException e) {
140           LOG.warn(
141               "Unable to contruct responder Id of type 'hash', falling back to"
142                   + " using 'name' as responder Id.",
143               e);
144           respId = new JcaRespID(signingCertificate.getSubjectX500Principal());
145         }
146       }
147       if (aOcspSigningCertificate == null) {
148         signingCertificateForOcspSigning = true; // CA cert
149       } else {
150         signingCertificateForOcspSigning =
151             CertTools.isOCSPCert(signingCertificate);
152       }
153       signingCertificateIssuerDn = CertTools.getIssuerDN(signingCertificate);
154       signingCertificateIssuerDnRaw =
155           signingCertificate.getIssuerDN().getName();
156     }
157     if (fullCertificateChain == null) {
158       responseCertChain = null;
159     } else {
160       responseCertChain =
161           getResponseCertChain(
162               fullCertificateChain.toArray(new X509Certificate[0]));
163     }
164   }
165 
166   /** @return certificate of the CA that we want to respond for */
167   public X509Certificate getIssuerCaCertificate() {
168     return issuerCaCertificate;
169   }
170 
171   /** @return certificate ID of the CA that we want to respond for */
172   public List<CertificateID> getCertificateID() {
173     return certificateID;
174   }
175 
176   /**
177    * @return the certificate revocation status for the CA that we want to
178    *     respond for at the time of cache reload
179    */
180   public CertificateStatus getIssuerCaCertificateStatus() {
181     return issuerCaCertificateStatus;
182   }
183 
184   /** @return the chain of all CA certificates */
185   public List<X509Certificate> getCaCertificateChain() {
186     return caCertificateChain;
187   }
188 
189   /**
190    * @return a OCSP signing certificate or null if this cache entry will use a
191    *     CA key to sign the response
192    */
193   public X509Certificate getOcspSigningCertificate() {
194     return ocspSigningCertificate;
195   }
196 
197   /**
198    * @return the full certificate chain that will be used to sign the OCSP
199    *     response. The first position is either an OCSP signing certificate or a
200    *     CA certificate.
201    */
202   public List<X509Certificate> getFullCertificateChain() {
203     return fullCertificateChain;
204   }
205 
206   /**
207    * @return the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP response. This
208    *     is either an OCSP signing certificate or a CA certificate.
209    */
210   public X509Certificate getSigningCertificate() {
211     return signingCertificate;
212   }
213 
214   /**
215    * @return the Issuer DN of the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP
216    *     response. BC normalized.
217    */
218   public String getSigningCertificateIssuerDn() {
219     return signingCertificateIssuerDn;
220   }
221 
222   /**
223    * @return the Issuer DN of the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP
224    *     response. Not normalized.
225    */
226   public String getSigningCertificateIssuerDnRaw() {
227     return signingCertificateIssuerDnRaw;
228   }
229 
230   /** @return the private key that will be used to sign the OCSP response. */
231   public PrivateKey getPrivateKey() {
232     return privateKey;
233   }
234 
235   /**
236    * @return the signature provider that should be used with this cache entries
237    *     private key.
238    */
239   public String getSignatureProviderName() {
240     return signatureProviderName;
241   }
242 
243   /**
244    * @return the OCSP key binding mapped by this entry or null if the private
245    *     key belongs to a CA.
246    */
247   public OcspKeyBinding getOcspKeyBinding() {
248     return ocspKeyBinding;
249   }
250 
251   /**
252    * @return one of the OcspConfiguration.RESPONDERIDTYPE_* values used by this
253    *     cache entry
254    */
255   public OcspKeyBinding.ResponderIdType getResponderIdType() {
256     return responderIdType;
257   }
258 
259   /** @return the actual responder type ASN1 object used by this cache entry */
260   public RespID getRespId() {
261     return respId;
262   }
263 
264   /**
265    * @return the part of the full certificate chain that has been configured to
266    *     be included in the response.
267    */
268   public X509Certificate[] getResponseCertChain() {
269     return responseCertChain;
270   }
271   /**
272    * Checks if the entry has a OCSP signing certificate separate from the
273    * certificate chain. Only entries with a keybinding can have a separate
274    * certificate.
275    *
276    * @return boolean
277    */
278   public boolean isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate() {
279     return ocspSigningCertificate != null;
280   }
281 
282   /**
283    * @return false when we are using a non-CA signing certificate and the
284    *     certificate lacks the OCSP signing EKU
285    */
286   public boolean isSigningCertificateForOcspSigning() {
287     return signingCertificateForOcspSigning;
288   }
289 
290   /**
291    * @return true if this entry is just a temporary placeholder that should be
292    *     replaced with the default responder when rebuilding the cache.
293    */
294   public boolean isPlaceholder() {
295     return privateKey == null;
296   }
297 
298   /**
299    * @return false for the first thread that invokes this method (a caller that
300    *     gets a false return value should verify the response signature)
301    */
302   public boolean checkResponseSignatureVerified() {
303     // There is a small race condition here, so multiple callers might get a
304     // "false" return value, but since this
305     // is a hot-path we don't want the overhead of synchronization for a large
306     // majority of the invocations
307     if (responseSignatureVerified) {
308       return true;
309     }
310     responseSignatureVerified = true;
311     return false;
312   }
313 
314   /**
315    * This method construct the certificate chain that will be included in the
316    * OCSP response according to the following rules: - If includeSignCert &&
317    * includeChain --> include entire chain except for the root CA certificate -
318    * If includeSignCert && !includeChain --> include only the signing
319    * certificate whatever it is (even if it was a root CA cert) - If
320    * !includingSignCert --> not including any certificate or chain no matter
321    * what value includeChain has. The value of the certificate chain will then
322    * be an empty array.
323    *
324    * @param certChain certificate chain
325    * @return the certificate chain that will be included in the OCSP response
326    */
327   private X509Certificate[] getResponseCertChain(
328           final X509Certificate[] certChain) {
329     X509Certificate[] chain;
330     boolean includeSignCert = OcspConfiguration.getIncludeSignCert();
331     boolean includeChain = OcspConfiguration.getIncludeCertChain();
332     // If we have an OcspKeyBinding we use this configuration to override the
333     // default
334     if (isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
335       includeSignCert = getOcspKeyBinding().getIncludeSignCert();
336       includeChain = getOcspKeyBinding().getIncludeCertChain();
337     }
338     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
339       LOG.debug("Include signing cert: " + includeSignCert);
340       LOG.debug("Include chain: " + includeChain);
341     }
342     if (includeSignCert) {
343       if (includeChain) {
344         if (certChain.length
345             > 1) { // certChain contained more than the root cert
346           // create a new array containing all the certs in certChain except for
347           // the root cert
348           chain = new X509Certificate[certChain.length - 1];
349           for (int i = 0; i < chain.length; i++) {
350             chain[i] = certChain[i];
351           }
352         } else { // certChain contains only the root cert
353           chain = certChain;
354         }
355       } else { // only the signing cert should be included in the OCSP response
356                // and not the entire cert chain
357         chain = new X509Certificate[1];
358         chain[0] = certChain[0];
359       }
360     } else {
361       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
362         LOG.debug("OCSP signing certificate is not included in the response");
363       }
364       chain = new X509Certificate[0];
365     }
366     return chain;
367   }
368 }
